metadata.title: CVE-2023-1729 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in LibRaw. A heap-buffer-overflow in raw2image_ex() caused by a maliciously crafted file may lead to an application crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.10.1
libraw20 - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: darktable package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.

kodi package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.10.1').
rawtherapee package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
